Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0090 b) Date of Occurrence: 30/03/2024
c) Installation Details: Mantis Recon - AC-1704-862 at
Regional Depot-A
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 08/04/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Turbine Assembly d) Main Assembly: Nose Section
e) Nomenclature: Turbine Assembly Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-A
g) Part No.: PR-3467-A4 h) Sl No.: SN-8123-524
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 23/03/2021 l) Date of Removal: 06/04/2024
Pg No: 31 Ln No: 8 Pg No: 135 Ln No: 14
m) Manufacturing Agency: Apex Defense Manufacturing n) Date, Month & Year May 2015
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2804 Hrs / 387 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Critical
b) Defect Observed: Starter generator malfunction. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Corrosion due to moisture accumulation in sealed compartment
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Turbine Assembly component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Repair damaged area using approved repair scheme
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Establish periodic calibration schedule
d) Attributable Code: N2 - Defect Not Confirmed
Remarks: Investigation completed as per established procedures. All findings documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 07/05/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type.
Date: 10/05/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions.
Date: 10/05/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur.
Date: 14/05/2024 Signature: Dr. A.K. Sharma
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions.
Date: 16/05/2024 Signature: Eng. K.N. Iyer
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
